title: Augusta County: William Clark Corson to Jennie [unknown], January 17, 1865
summary: William Clark Corson did not live in Augusta County, Virginia, but he served in the Virginia cavalry and saw action in the Shenandoah Valley. In this letter, he writes his fiance about his journey through the Valley to join his brigade and his life at camp. He mentions a "Free negro" and describes a poor white family who housed him on his journey. He characterizes camp life as one of deprivation; even the soldiers' horses went without feed. He closes his letter by expressing his dedication to his fiance.
keywords: OCR scanned from transcription held at the Virginia Historical Society.
